div1.p: Carter is ill and takes quinine for treatment. He writes about packing, family news, and his garden.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Armistead Carter, September 16, 1911
div1.p:
I have not written to you
since the scolding letter of Monday
We packed until Thursday & then I
was taken sick-indeed I had been
feeling badly since Monday evening
but “laid up” Thursday & took Qui-
nine. I was not much sick-except
from the Q.- & a provisional diag-
nosis of Mal. fever was made al-
though I did not find Plasmodia.
Temp. was only 1015/100 & normal this mor-
ning.

Packing finished same for a few “last
things” for which 2 boxes are left
open one to stay & one to go Also await your arrival.
This is your mothers idea, mine
is that you would rather things
went some what wrong than
have to decide. We can tell
when you arrive & I will take
all responsibility. I do not mind
deciding wrong; I have done
so too often, I keep the Kipling
& Oxford E. Verse to read on str.

Ned left for N. R. Thursday even-
ing. I am very fond of the boy
but if he was only different. I
do believe him to be of un
sound mind.

Sally's berth is engaged for Sept
27th.
Your mother is very well
waiting on me has “braced
her up”, she & Sally went to the
Library yesterday to carry
books back!

The last gladioli are in the
vase-2 very fine & 3 good.
The Roses are very fine, but
are having too much rain
as I have them mulched.
I will have it removed
Monday.

This is just a little letter
my dear, as things are stir-
red up to some little ex-
tent

Your mother is over at the
Dressmaker's having some
dress made shorter!

Remember me kindly to
Dr.'s Hamman & Watson
& to the Head-of-section nurse &
take the best of care of your-
self.

Hasta la vista y eso pron-
tission hijita mia.

I feel like calling you
“Carita” for “Quenda” means one de-
fined as a sweetheart doesn't it?
5
yet I am afraid
“Carita” might be held
a personality not
unconnected with the
bills of the New-
port trip & then J. Hop-
kins. How is it!
I say this because I
was going to put Que
ida instead I put
Hija - Hija is right
any way
